page.title: 18LAND USE IN OUR AREA
page.content: In our area the tops of hills are used for grazing sheep,the middle land is used for growing crops.The crops include Barley,Corn and hay.Sheep graze the tops of our hills because the grass is finer.Horses are grazed throughout the area.Down near the river no crops are grown because in the flood season they would be spoilt. Houses aren't built near the river for the same reason.In the past trees were allowed to grow near the river for fuel and game animals they provided. Usually the big fields are used for growing the crops and small fields are used for grazing or hay production. Horrabridge is situated at the crossroads between Whitchurch, Samford, Yelverton & Walkhamton ,on a crossing point of the River Walkham.It is around 1/2 square kilometre in area.
